image.altText: Elon Musk with his hands clasped together.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's attempts to fight orders to remove graphic footage of the Sydney stabbings from X provokes fury among federal politicians, who are renewing their focus on punishing social media platforms that host misinformation and harmful content.

title.children: Musk's response to Sydney stabbing footage prompts fury, as opposition supports crackdown on social media giants

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: From the east to the west, a spate of knife attacks sent fear through Sydney this week. While violent knife crime is declining nationally, buried under the top-line statistics is a more complicated picture.

title.children: Four days, five unrelated stabbing attacks: Sydney's horror week puts spotlight on knife crime

image.altText: A blonde woman with glasses smiles as she holds a puppy to her face

props.synopsis: Karen Moore was already fostering nine cats and four puppies at her Adelaide home when she received an email from another family needing to surrender their pet due to the rising cost of living.

title.children: 'The cost has just about doubled': Cost of living forcing Australians to surrender their beloved pets

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark dress sits on a couch and holds a framed photograph.

props.synopsis: A dying mum could only communicate by blinking. She needed hospital staff to help convey a message, but they didn't want to hear it.

title.children: A mother's message and the hospital that didn't want to hear it

image.altText: A close up of a man and a woman staring at each other eyes against a backdrop of planes flying over mountains.

props.synopsis: Myanmar has started to impose conscription laws that require young men and women to join the military. But people the ABC spoke to are considering getting married or fleeing the country to exploit a loophole.

title.children: 'We had to force ourselves to get married': Why couples in Myanmar are booking weddings to save the bride

image.altText: A mother holding her young son

props.synopsis: One in 10 children will have a proven food allergy in their first year of life, and by school, there'll be at least one child in every classroom. Yet, there is still no approved treatment and more services are desperately needed.

title.children: Australia 'has a big problem' with food allergies, but the exact cause is unknown

image.altText: Two white women wearing white political campaign t shirts stand and smile by the side of a road

props.synopsis: Two lifelong friends join forces to campaign for a single seat in federal parliament. They want to show that politics can be done differently – but not everyone's convinced it can work.

title.children: These two women are running for federal parliament as a single candidate

image.altText: Taylor Swift's new album cover in black and white with Taylor standing in the middle in a long white t shirt

props.synopsis: The pop sensation now holds the record for most-streamed album in a single day across Spotify, Apple, and Amazon Music.

title.children: Taylor Swift's The Tortured Poets Department breaks multiple records in 24 hours

image.altText: A man holding and looking at a canister or bottle labelled as "pepper spray"

props.synopsis: Western Australia is the only Australian state or territory which allows people to have pepper spray for self-protection, and there have been calls to legalise the substance country-wide in the wake of Bondi's stabbing attack.

title.children: WA is the only Australian jurisdiction where it's legal to have pepper spray. Self-defence advocates want that to change

image.altText: Red, orange and pink light shimmering against the night sky.

props.synopsis: Stargazers were treated to another light show as the Aurora Australis again revealed itself in the skies above South Australia and Tasmania in the early hours of Saturday.

title.children: Aurora Australis goes 'berserk' across South Australian and Tasmanian skies

image.altText: A cargo ship stacked with shipping containers is docked at the Port.

props.synopsis: As the world's economy fragments and more countries assert their right to restructure their economies, what path will Australia take?

title.children: After decades of rising economic integration, the global economy is fragmenting. What can Australia do about it?

image.altText: woman standing on balcony

props.synopsis: Gail Cocksedge says she has built "a beautiful little nest of people" around her since her husband left her 40 years ago. She is glad she was younger when they separated, given the financial impact.

title.children: Gail, 73, is living proof that age matters when it comes to divorce, as research shows extent of financial impact

image.altText: A map of Sydney alongside a woman shopping in a supermarket

props.synopsis: The cost of food is being felt nationally, but for some pockets of Australia, including parts of Greater Western Sydney, accessing nutritious food was already difficult. Some experts fear it could worsen health problems.

title.children: How the cost-of-living crisis is placing pressure on Australia's 'food deserts'

image.altText: Two side by side photos of Princess Anne and Queen Elizabeth II wearing the same purple checked coat

props.synopsis: Wearing our late loved one's clothes is the sort of thing we all do — a poignant way to keep them close. It's also very Princess Anne and one reason she continues to poll among the most popular royals in the UK's monarchy.

title.children: When Princess Anne stepped out wearing her late mother's coat, it symbolised exactly why she's so popular

image.altText: A composite of a harvard medical school buiding and a mugshot of a man with half face tattoo

props.synopsis: Investigators in the United States allege both morgue staff and collectors were part of an underground community willing to pay top dollar for human remains.

title.children: A group of people allegedly traded human remains stolen from facilities across the US. Officials say they may never know how many families were affected

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Still bragging about that one time you won trivia? I'll fix that.

title.children: Bit of a self-confessed quiz expert? I’ll be the judge of that. Let's play, HARD

image.altText: A Bigambul and Kamilaroi artist wearing a black hoodie holds up a golden lion trophy onstafe with thre other people.

props.synopsis: Bigambul and Kamilaroi artist Archie Moore becomes the first Australian artist to win the top gong in Venice with his monumental work kith and kin.

title.children: First Nations artist wins top honour at prestigious Venice Biennale

image.altText: Specialist staff at the Howard Springs facility wear heavy PPE gear.

props.synopsis: A joint inquest into the deaths of three people has heard of failings and extreme pressures at the Howard Springs quarantine facility during COVID.

title.children: Three deaths at Australia's 'gold standard' quarantine centre are being probed by the NT coroner

image.altText: A Russian tank fires into the distance

props.synopsis: After stalling for months, billions of dollars in aid for Ukraine as well as money for Israel is approved by the US House.

title.children: $60b Ukraine aid package finally passes US House

image.altText: Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi greet a sea of supporters from the top of a truck in the southern city of Hyderabad, November 2023.

props.synopsis: Rahul Gandhi is the only serious challenger Narendra Modi faces in India. And this time, he's fighting with a mega-alliance to "save democracy".

title.children: 'Fearless and capable': Rahul Gandhi is the man hoping to topple Narendra Modi in the world's biggest election

image.altText: TikTok Block?

props.synopsis: The bill would force TikTok's Chinese owners to sell within 12 months or be banned in America.

title.children: US House approves TikTok ban bill that would affect 170m people

image.altText: A group of people sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: China's top diplomat Wang Yi takes a swipe at the geo-political jostling for influence in the Pacific, saying Pacific Island countries aren't "the backyard of any major country".

title.children: China's foreign minister visits PNG, saying Pacific nations aren't 'the backyard' of other countries

image.altText: A man wearing a work shirt smiles in front of an open fuse box.

props.synopsis: Research shows people in the building and construction industry are more likely to suffer mental health issues, and the current issues in the sector are only making it worse.

title.children: After suffering depression and anxiety for years, James now runs his electrical business differently

image.altText: A young girl with dark hair tied back, looks over a netball court. The photo is taken from behind her.

props.synopsis: Abusive adults are ruining the joy of sport for children across Australia, but new campaigns aim to stamp the behaviour out.

title.children: Bad behaviour from 'delusional' parents forces sporting codes to take action as athletes, umpires as young as 10 cop verbal abuse

image.altText: A young girl sitting next to a lion.

props.synopsis: When MGM peaked, it reached for the stars, creating some of the most famous films in history. But when it struggled, it fell deep, only staying afloat with a Las Vegas tycoon and selling all its memorabilia.

title.children: 'You'll never see the likes of this again': Unpacking 100 years of one of Hollywood's biggest film studios

image.altText: A woman wearing an Archery Australia cap looks down at her arrow as she notches it on her bow.

props.synopsis: Para-archer Ameera Lee, who lives with multiple sclerosis, is closing in on her Paralympic debut in Paris, thanks to the support of her teenage son.

title.children: 'Never give up': Archer Ameera Lee targets a spot at Paris Paralympics

image.altText: A still from Bluey showing two sheepdogs and a jack russell looking at a for sale sign.

props.synopsis: From poodles and pugs to dalmatians and beagles, Bluey is a hotbed of all the different dogs out there. But what are they like in real life?

title.children: Kelpies, pugs, poodles — meet the dogs of Bluey

image.altText: Cooked chicken breast and a halved lemon in a black skillet on a stovetop

props.synopsis: With only 10 minutes of prep time required and not much longer in the pan and oven, this recipe offers maximum flavour for minimal effort.

title.children: A chicken dinner with a spice twist that takes less than half an hour to make

image.altText: A house, sheds and grain storage silos surrounded by trees on a flat plain divided into cropping paddocks

props.synopsis: Farmers raise concerns about consultation practices, radiation and the contamination of their crops at a hearing into VHM's proposed Goschen mineral sands and rare earths mine.

title.children: Mineral sands mine sparks land use battle in northern Victoria

image.altText: A film still of Sofia Boutella in a bloody dirty top, holding a gun in each hand, one pointing at the screen

props.synopsis: Rebel Moon 2 shows that the real epic battle is between reckless visionary artists and the Hollywood executives trying to rein them in.

title.children: Zack Snyder's Rebel Moon is a Star Wars wannabe and — spoiler — it's never gonna be

image.altText: Two men standing on a beach point to a large mass of sticks and logs

props.synopsis: There are concerns about the impact on beachgoers and marine traffic near the mouth of the Hawkesbury River as debris continues to appear weeks after torrential rain brought flooding to Sydney's west.

title.children: Twenty-metre floating island appears in Sydney's north following Hawkesbury floods

image.altText: Close up of Brittany Higgins.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins has posted a statement following last week's judgment in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case. Justice Michael Lee found Ms Higgins was raped at Parliament House.

title.children: 'No judgment was ever going to change this truth': Brittany Higgins breaks silence after Lehrmann defamation case

image.altText: An 18-year-old female sprinter crosses the line in first place, with a smile, wearing a top and sprinting shorts.

props.synopsis: Torrie Lewis beats world 100m champion Sha'Carri Richardson en route to a magnificent victory over 200m in her first Diamond League race in China.

title.children: Aussie sprint ace Torrie Lewis roars to Diamond League win

image.altText: A man with his hand lifted about a chess board.

props.synopsis: Tunde Onakoya, 29, hopes to raise $1 million for children's education across Africa through the record attempt that began on Wednesday.

title.children: Chess champion completes 60-hour chess marathon in world record attempt
